front.title: Resource ReserVation Protocol-Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) Signaling Procedure for Resource Sharing-based LSP Setup/Teardown

abstract.t: Generalized Multiprotocol Label Switching (GMPLS) defines a set of protocols for the creation of Label Switched Paths (LSPs) in various switching technologies. It can be used for different types of switching technologies. This document compliments existing standards by explaining the missing pieces of information during the Resource ReserVation Protocol-Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) signaling procedure in support of resource sharing-based LSP setup/teardown in GMPLS-controlled circuit networks.
